content: minneapolis ice melt hat a quick and simple crochet hat a sign of peaceful resistance supplies worsted weight red yarn 150-200 yds more for the larger sizes h and g hooks or size needed for gauge 2 removable stitch markers tapestry needle notes hat is worked in the round from the bottom up rs always facing do not turn after rounds pattern is written in a small size stitch counts for med and lg are included stitches used see stitch guide for directions foundation double_crochet fdc front post double_crochet fpdc and back post double_crochet bpdc extended single_crochet esc extended single_crochet 2 together esc2tog double_crochet double_crochet slip_stitch slip_stitch chain chain gauge in fpdc/bpdc rib with h hook 8 stitches and 7 row is 2 x 2 in esc with g hook 10 stitches and 8 row is 2 x 2 pattern rib section with h begin 61 fdc 69 77 approximately 20 22 24 slightly stretched being careful not to twist join with slip_stitch to top of beg chain 4 later use the tail to attach the bottom edge of the stitches r1 ch2 fpdc around first fdc bpdc around next fdc cont fpdc bpdc around join with slip_stitch to top of beg ch2 note chains are not worked as post stitches r2 ch2 fpdc around fpdc bpdc around bpdc around join with slip_stitch to top of chain 2 r3-r18 repeat r2 rib will be approximately 6 tall continue repeating r2 for a longer rib hat section r1 ch3 double_crochet in each fpdc and bpdc around join with slip_stitch to top of chain 3 61 double_crochet 69 77 keep this round loose to stretch with the rib change to g r2 ch2 esc in next 14 16 18 double_crochet pm in 15th 17th 19th double_crochet esc in next 29 33 37 double_crochet pm in 30th 34th 38th double_crochet esc in rem double_crochet join with slip_stitch to top of ch2 continue to work continuously in the round without joining r3 *esc to last 2 st before marker esc2tog esc in marked st and move marker up esc2tog in next 2 esc* repeat btw * esc rem st in round repeat r3 until 8 stitches remain slip_stitch in next st f/o leaving a 3 -4 tail set hat aside and use yarn to make a thick braid tuck one end into the opening in the top of the hat from the inside use tapestry needle and yarn tail weave around opening and pull tight also secure end of braid use beginning yarn tail to secure beginning of first round of double_crochet stitch guide foundation double_crochet fdc r1 chain 4 sts yo insert hook into 4th chain from hk pull up lp yo draw through 1 lp the chain yo draw through 2 lps twice the double_crochet r2 yo insert hk under 2 lps of the chain portion of last st and pull up lp yo and draw through 1 lp yo and draw through 2 lps twice repeat r2 for desired length front
